title: Special Counsel Interviewed Biden About Classified Documents
description: Robert Hur, the special counsel appointed to investigate how sensitive material ended up at the home and office of President Biden, met with the president over the past two days.

title: Will Hurd Drops Out of G.O.P. Presidential Race and Endorses Haley
description: The former congressman, who had staked out an anti-Trump position, failed to gain traction in a crowded field.

title: At Least 11 U.S. Citizens Were Killed in Israel, Biden Says, and Others May Be Captives of Hamas
description: “I have directed my team to work with their Israeli counterparts on every aspect of the hostage crisis, including sharing intelligence,” the president said in a statement on Monday evening.

title: McCarthy Floats Return as Divided G.O.P. Meets to Choose a Speaker
description: Less than a week after his ouster, the former speaker indicated he would be open to reinstatement as Republicans prepared to discuss whom to nominate to succeed him.

title: Hollywood Writers Ratify New Contract With Studios
description: The vote, which followed the end of the strike on Sept. 27, officially brought to a close a bitter, five-month labor dispute. The actors remain on strike.

title: The Attack on Israel Demands Unity and Resolve
description: America and other allies have a crucial role to play in supporting Israel at this painful moment.

title: A clash at the border between Israel and Lebanon adds to fears of a multi-front battle.
Skeletons of 1918 Flu Victims Reveal Clues About Who Was Likely to Die
description: While a narrative emerged that the pandemic indiscriminately struck the young and healthy, new evidence suggests that frail young adults were most vulnerable.

title: ‘For All the Dogs’ and Drake’s Latest Season of Discontent
description: The rapper’s new album, “For All the Dogs,” comes after a summer of live-show triumph and extra-musical boredom.

title: Charles Feeney, Who Made a Fortune and Then Gave It Away, Dies at 92
description: After piling up billions in business, he pledged to donate almost all of his money to causes before he died. He succeeded, and then lived a more modest life.

title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to Run for President as Independent, Leaving Democratic Primary
description: The political scion told supporters he would end his campaign as a Democratic candidate and run as an independent, potentially upsetting the dynamics of the 2024 election.

title: Green Energy Casts a Shadow Over a Cherished English Landscape
description: Residents of East Anglia fear that planned power lines for offshore wind projects will blight their rural idyll.

title: U.A.W. Workers at Mack Truck Go on Strike
description: The strike at the truck manufacturer by 4,000 members of the United Automobile Workers comes in the middle of the union’s strikes at three large U.S. car companies.

title: Nikki Haley Raises $11 Million, Battling With DeSantis to Take on Trump
description: The former South Carolina governor has made gains in recent months — in fund-raising and polling — that have helped her compete for the No. 2 spot in the primary field.

title: Zelensky Compares Hamas’s Assault on Israel to Russia’s Invasion of Ukraine
description: The Ukrainian president said in a speech to NATO that “terror will have no allies” if the world unites against hostage-taking and other acts of aggression.

title: The Global Context of the Hamas-Israel War
description: The Hamas attack is a sign of a new world order.

title: Claudia Goldin Wins Nobel in Economics for Studying Women in the Work Force
description: Her research uncovered the reasons for differences in labor force participation and earnings for women. She is the third woman to win the economics Nobel.

title: War in Israel
description: Palestinian militants launched the biggest attack against Israel in 50 years, prompting intense retaliation.

title: The Republican Meltdown Shows No Sign of Cooling Off
description: A basic rule of Trumpism is that he always gets worse. And the world isn’t getting any better, either.

title: Does the Supreme Court’s Cherry-Picking Inject Politics Into Judging?
description: By choosing among and sometimes writing the questions the court agrees to answer, recent studies say, the justices have distorted the judicial process.

title: Scalise, a McCarthy Rival, Seeks to Unite Republicans in Taking His Place
description: The second-ranking Republican, who was cut out of major decisions by the previous speaker, is pitching himself as uniquely positioned to unify the deeply divided House G.O.P.

title: Russia’s Economy Is Increasingly Structured Around Its War in Ukraine
description: The nation’s finances have proven resilient, despite punishing sanctions, giving it leeway to pump money into its military machine.

title: What We Can Do to Make the House Less Dysfunctional
description: We need to rethink party primaries — which give our politicians all the wrong incentives.

title: Is It Still Worth Going to the Movies?
description: After 23 years of film criticism, I was back in front of the screen as a civilian. I had no idea what I would find.

title: Grizzlies Are Increasing in Numbers. Learning to Live With Them.
description: Montana and its neighbors are adopting new strategies to deal with the increasing number of bears and attacks on humans.

title: Schools Are Not Ready for Climate Change
description: A storm can last a day. But the disruption to learning can last years. As natural disasters become more common, school districts are grappling with how to adapt.

title: Ozempic Can’t Fix What Our Culture Has Broken
description: When women say that it is better to be sick and thin than healthy and fat, they are perfectly rational.

title: Head to East Bay, Rhode Island, for an Idyllic Fall Weekend Getaway
description: The farm stands, art galleries and land-conservation efforts in the East Bay region show why fall is the golden season in the Ocean State.

title: Vaults, Ducts, Kitchens: Everything Must Go When a Company Moves Out
description: As companies reduce their office footprint to accommodate remote work, they are turning to decommissioning teams to clear out furniture, fixtures and equipment.

title: El Anatsui Builds Monumental Art From Daily Life
description: As his newest sculptures fill Tate Modern’s Turbine Hall, the Ghanaian artist is returning to his roots and thinking about his legacy.

title: Parking in New York City Really Is Worse Than Ever
description: There are more cars but fewer available spots on the street. There are fewer garages — and exorbitant prices. For city drivers, it’s a growing headache.

title: Parking in New York City Really Is Worse Than Ever
description: There are more cars but fewer available spots on the street. There are fewer garages — and exorbitant prices. For city drivers, it’s a growing headache.

title: A Fake Loan Could Mean Real Trouble for George Santos
description: Representative George Santos was seemingly implicated in a fraudulent loan scheme that his treasurer admitted in her guilty plea.

title: In Nagorno-Karabakh, We Just Saw What the World Is About to Become
description: The conflict over Nagorno-Karabakh is a harbinger of global disorder.

title: What Is Indigenous Peoples’ Day and How Is It Celebrated?
description: Many cities and states are observing the day. Here’s some of the history behind it.
